intro: Hibbertia, commonly known as the flame flower or honeyplant, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Dilleniaceae. These plants are native to Australia and are characterized by their striking, tubular flowers that range in color from yellow to orange and red. Hibbertia species typically have narrow, lance-shaped leaves and are often found in dry, sandy soils. They are known for their ability to thrive in arid conditions, making them well adapted to the Australian landscape. Many species are cultivated for their ornamental value due to their vibrant blooms and unique appearance.
